definition: to mock oneself/to laugh at oneself

sentences.english: Self-deprecating inquiry into the time necessary to infiltrate system.
sentences.chinese: 利用滲透系統時間進行自嘲。

sentences.english: Discuss your situation with humor and self-deprecation.
sentences.chinese: 用一種幽默和自嘲的語氣來談論你的狀況。

sentences.english: When a person can no longer laugh at himself, it is time for others to laugh at him. —Thomas Szasz.
sentences.chinese: 當一個人不再自嘲，那就到了他被別人嘲笑的時候了。

sentences.english: I absolutely advocate telling a self-deprecating joke.
sentences.chinese: 我絕對主張講一個自嘲的笑話。
這就是她善於自嘲的特點。

sentences.english: Whenever we should have confidence, and also have enough courage to self-mockery.
sentences.chinese: 任何時候都該有信心，也要有足夠的勇氣自嘲。

sentences.english: His self-deprecation nearly won over the audience.
sentences.chinese: 他的自嘲，幾乎已經快打動觀衆。

sentences.english: Be proud of who you are, but don't lose the ablity to laught at yourself.
sentences.chinese: 爲自己感到驕傲，但別忘了適當的自嘲。

sentences.english: Good timing, Alicia, I thought to myself sarcastically .
sentences.chinese: 挑的好時間，艾麗西婭，我不無自嘲地想道。

sentences.english: Rachel and Evan laugh about the last time they argued at their Washington-area home.
sentences.chinese: 瑞秋和埃文自嘲了他們最近在華盛頓家中的一次爭吵。

sentences.english: The ex-clone captain chuckled quietly to himself as he leaned against the cool railings of the small balcony.
sentences.chinese: 他倚着小陽臺涼涼的欄杆，前任克隆人上尉輕笑自嘲。

sentences.english: Self - mockery may sometimes mask great conceit.
sentences.chinese: 自嘲有時隱藏很大的自負。

sentences.english: It's ver important to learn self-scorning in one's life.
sentences.chinese: 學會自嘲，在人生中極其重要。

sentences.english: And so the mudding of self-pity and ridicule continued.
sentences.chinese: 我就這樣自憐和自嘲下去。

sentences.english: Blue Joe shut an eye, self-ridicule floor a laugh.
sentences.chinese: 藍喬閉了眼，自嘲地一笑。

sentences.english: He widened his eyes in self-ridicule, then, the next moment, his expression became somber.
sentences.chinese: 他瞪大眼自嘲道，一會兒，他的表情變得嚴肅起來。

definition: to refer to one's foibles or failings with self-deprecating humor
to comfort oneself/to console oneself/to reassure oneself
to sigh with sorrow, regret etc/rueful/deeply moved
to tease/to poke fun at/to make fun of
to talk to oneself/to think aloud/to soliloquize
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
